result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Stanisch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments surcharges and DNA surcharge.  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.  Balance as condition of Extended Supervision/end of sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendasnt and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes: Drug programs or treatment as recommended.  Random screening.  No illegally controlled substances.
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay DNA surcaharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (21 pages) commencing JULY 11, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court with attorney Perry P. Lieuallen.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -2  years; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) drug programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds;
- the letter provided to the Court by the State sealed.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Letters for sentencing received and filed./ds

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court with attorney Perry P Lieuallen.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court with attorney Perry P Lieuallen.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
No reply from defendant.

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court with attorney Perry P Lieuallen.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad

14RM020151  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-11-14

Attorney Perry P Lieuallen in court, defendant Matthew A Stanisch not in court, in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Bail argued by counsel.   Court sets bail at $100 cash TOT to Justice Point 1) no illegally controlled substances; 2) random screening.  Case remains set for 5-6-14 at 8:30 a.m.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has tested positive for opioid.  Defendant failing to comply with monitoring, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Court sets case for bail hearing on 4-11-14 at 8:30 a.m.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court with attorney Perry P. Lieuallen.  Laura A. Crivello for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court with attorney Perry P. Lieuallen.  Nathaniel Adamson for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/20/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jesse A or Co-Defendant Jared Gardipee

Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Matthew A Stanisch in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
